Description: 731 Roman copper alloy coin fragments. All nummi, made between AD 350 and 450. Almost all the coins have been halved with the exception of a few small modular imitations.
State: Associated with: Roman Empire Ancient Greece and Rome: Roman Empire
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie (c.1900)
Curator's comments: Sample of hoard no. 1 (out of six hoards) found by Sir Flinders Petrie at Hawara around 1900. Hawara hoard no. 1 was reported to have been about 1300 nummi fragments in a jar. Virtually all were halved coins dating from the AD 350s (the smallest module late Fel Temp nummi) up to the second quarter of the fifth century AD. Some of the Hawara coins were donated by Flinders Petrie directly: 1934,0902
Bibliographic references: Pearce 1938 / More Late AES from Egypt (p.117)
Acquisition name: Donated by: J W E Pearce
